title: Biden says the US will stop arms shipments to Israel if it invades Rafah
summary: The US president in an interview with CNN on Wednesday issued his most direct warning yet to deter Israel's Rafah invasion. He also acknowledged that 'civilians have been killed in Gaza as a consequence of those [American] bombs.'

title: Olympic torch arrives in Marseille – in images
summary: Tens of thousands of people gathered Wednesday in the southern French city of Marseille to welcome the Olympic torch and mark another milestone in the lead-up to the Games in Paris.

title: Climate: Why France and Europe are warming faster than average
summary: Countries experience climate change differently; the proximity of the Arctic zone and atmospheric circulation explain why France and Europe are already experiencing warming one degree higher than average.

title: Where did the water that flowed on Mars over four billion years ago go?
summary: Despite the 2018 discovery of a vast underground lake beneath the Martian ice sheet, scientists are struggling to find contemporary traces of liquid water on the Red Planet.

title: Debate over fish aggregating devices in the Indian Ocean intensifies
summary: As the next meeting of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission gets underway, the NGO BLOOM Association published a comparative analysis between this industrial technique and traditional pole-and-line fishing in the Maldives.

title: Champions League: Real Madrid stage late comeback to beat Bayern 2-1 and reach final
summary: Real Madrid came from behind to score two late goals on Wednesday to win 4-3 on aggregate, advancing to the Champions League final for the second time in three seasons.

title: North Macedonia's nationalist opposition sweeps elections
summary: The Balkan country is set for rocky ties with EU neighbors as the country's right-wing VMRO-DPMNE party earned an easy victory in both presidential and parliamentary elections.

title: Steve Albini, musician and producer for Nirvana, the Pixies and PJ Harvey, is dead at 61
summary: The alternative rock pioneer behind many of the genre's classics died of a heart attack Tuesday night.

title: Trump trial: Stormy Daniels gives a detailed account of their one-night stand
summary: The hush money payment of $130,000, made to the former adult film star in exchange for her silence ahead of the 2016 presidential election, is an essential part of the charges leveled against the former US president.

title: Xi Jinping's visit to France fails to dispel clouds hanging over bilateral relations
summary: On Tuesday, the two heads of state visited the Hautes-Pyrénées in southern France. This 'personal' trip was marred by wintry weather.

title: Emma Rafowicz, the French Socialist undaunted by anti-Semitic attacks
summary: Running in 8th place on the French Parti Socialiste's list of candidates for the European elections, the president of the Young Socialists has been targeted due to her family ties with an Israeli army spokesman.

title: Hentai, the Japanese pornographic anime conquering the world
summary: These manga and anime allow unrivaled freedom in the representation of fantasies by graphically marking their distance from reality, writes Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette.

title: Washington police clear pro-Palestinian university protest camp
summary: The encampment of pro-Palestinian protestors, which had entered its second week since being established, was cleared by DC police on the same day that the city's mayor and police chief were due to testify before Congress, a hearing which was then canceled.

title: China's Xi, Serbian president hail 'ironclad' friendship in Belgrade
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping is holding talks with his Serbian counterpart in Belgrade as Beijing seeks to deepen its political and economic ties with countries it sees as allies in Europe.

title: European elections: Macron's camp presents 48-part agenda and candidate list dominated by incumbents
summary: The three leaders of the majority parties, Edouard Philippe (Horizons), François Bayrou (MoDem) and Stéphane Séjourné (Renaissance), as well as former prime minister Elisabeth Borne appear at the bottom of Valérie Hayer's slate.

title: Sweden's sudden awakening to corruption
summary: From small arrangements between friends to large-scale bribery and embezzlement, Swedes are discovering the extent of a phenomenon they had underestimated.

title: Israel says it reopened Kerem Shalom border crossing for Gaza aid
summary: The move comes four days after the border crossing was closed in response to a rocket attack that killed four soldiers.

title: India gears up for the European motorcycle market
summary: By reviving old, defunct brands, the subcontinent's major companies are aiming to overtake the Chinese and gain a foothold in a growing market.

title: 'In the European Parliament, the resources of industrial lobbies are huge'
summary: Faustine Bas-Defossez, from the European Environmental Bureau, a network that brings together NGOs from across the continent, describes how lobby groups have worked to obstruct environmental measures in Strasbourg and Brussels since 2019.

title: The secret to marsupial gliding
summary: American scientists have figured out how the patagium, the natural parachute that enables many mammal species to glide, came into being.

title: Nikola Jokic named NBA Most Valuable Player for third time
summary: The 29-year-old Serbian star of the Denver Nuggets, who already won the award in 2021 and 2022, beat out Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Luka Doncic for the prestigious award.

title: Europe's reindustrialization: A challenging work in progress
summary: Faced with crushing competition from China and the US, EU member states have revised their strategy to provide greater support for their factories. Yet their efforts remain far from sufficient.

title: Brazil: Death toll from massive flooding surpasses 100
summary: Rio Grande Do Sul State Governor Eduardo Leite cautioned that the number of casualties was expected to increase as 'the emergency is continuing to develo' in the state capital of Porto Alegre and other municipalities.

title: In Japan, yakuza are reduced to stealing Pokémon cards
summary: Organized crime syndicates are losing ground in the country while Pokémon merchandise has regained value since the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Marseille welcomes Olympic torch in festive kick-off for Paris 2024 – and 'it feels good'
summary: Some 230,000 people attended the arrival of the Olympic torch aboard the Belem ship. The ceremony included an airshow by the Patrouille de France and the surprise appearance of local star rapper Jul as torchbearer.

title: How billionaire Taylor Swift built her empire
summary: In 2023, the 34-year-old became the first singer in the world to achieve billionaire status solely through her music and concerts. Her career is shaking up an entire industry.

title: Biden announces halt to deliveries of offensive weapons to Israel
summary: In an interview with CNN broadcasting on the evening of May 8, the American president acknowledged that civilians had been killed in Gaza by bombs supplied by the US. On Tuesday, the White House confirmed the suspension of an arms shipment to Israel.

title: Ukraine Parliament adopts a law to enlist certain prisoners
summary: The country is trying to respond to the shortage of volunteers after over two years of war, which has claimed a heavy death toll and exhausted troops. Only prisoners with up to 3 years left to serve will be accepted.

title: China formally bans 'Glory to Hong Kong' protest anthem
summary: This song, created during the 2019 pro-democracy movement, has often been mistakenly played in international sporting competitions in place of the Chinese national anthem. This confusion is seen as an insult by the regime.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'What are we left with to envision a dynamic favorable to the creation of a Palestinian state?'
summary: The American and Israeli leaders, Joe Biden and Benjamin Netanyahu, no longer agree on anything, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Taylor Swift European tour kicks off in Paris with four shows and 42,000 spectators
summary: As the European leg of the superstar's Eras Tour kicks off on Thursday, fans were already queueing on Wednesday for merchandise.

title: Boeing 737 catches fire in Senegal, bursts tire in Turkey
summary: A Boeing 737 caught fire in Senegal on Thursday after skidding off the runway, while passengers and crew onboard another 737 in Turkey had to be evacuated after the aircraft's tire burst.

title: What do Christians celebrate on Ascension Day?
summary: On May 9, Christians celebrate the Ascension, symbolizing Jesus' ascent to God. Le Monde explores the history and symbolism of one of Christianity's most important feasts.

title: Aboriginal Australian children are too often removed from their families
summary: In the state of New South Wales, they account for just 4.5% of the child population, but represented 47% of young people put into care in 2023. The authorities have pledged to reform a child protection system that is now outdated.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Rafah terminal is at crossroads of tense diplomatic game
summary: Egypt and the US did not oppose the Israeli army's return to the crossing point into Gaza, a sign of the discreet negotiations between these two countries and Israel. Yet a military operation in Rafah remains a red line for them.

title: Paris 2024: How are Olympic torchbearers selected?
summary: The process of selecting 10,000 torchbearers from all over France was rather unclear.

title: Morocco to become rare military drone manufacturer, thanks to cooperation with Israel
summary: Israeli company BlueBird Aero Systems has announced the imminent start-up of a production facility in Rabat.

title: Coca-Cola and the Olympics, the alliance of soda and rings
summary: The American giant, the Olympic torch relay's official sponsor, has enjoyed a close relationship with the IOC for nearly a century. Despite health and plastic pollution concerns, the partnership has become so close that it's hard to say who runs the Games.

title: Stormy Daniels denies cashing in on claimed tryst with Trump
summary: The adult movie star concluded her testimony in Donald Trump's hush money trial Thursday after spending roughly 7 1/2 hours on the stand over two days.
